page.title: 06Ecology. River Foss
page.content: The River Foss. We studied the River Foss from Yearsley Bridge for 1/2 mile upstream. There were minnows,leeches and tadpoles.There were also mallards and water hens.Trees on the bank were alder,willow,elder and birch.Smaller plants were harebells,rose bay willow herb and convolvulus.We took samples of water and mud from the river.The water showed no sign of polution.Mud samples showed that sand and clay were present.We tested the depth of the river.The deepest part of the channel was about 80cms.The river is 6 metres wide.We tested the speed of the river by timing a piece of wood over 10 metres.The fastest time,near the weir, was 46 seconds.The slowest time,near the bank,was 2 and a 1/2 minutes.
